CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a deputy prosecutor in GPE , GPE , added the applicant ’s name to the list of fugitives from justice and issued an arrest warrant on suspicion of human trafficking with the purpose of sexual exploitation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE ordered the applicant ’s detention pending extradition , referring to ORG and CARDINAL of LAW but without setting a time - limit .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Prosecutor General ’s office received a request for the applicant ’s extradition from his counterpart in GPE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the deputy ORG ordered the applicant ’s extradition to GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the extradition order before ORG . On DATE ORG found that the extradition order was lawful . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the decision on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was extradited to GPE .
